name: Centaur
source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse
description: Centaurs gallop throughout the multiverse and trace their origins to many different realms.

name: Fairy
source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse
description: Infused with the magic of the Feywild, most fairies look like Small elves with insectile wings, but each fairy has a special physical characteristic that sets the fairy apart.

name: Harengon
source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse
description: Harengons are blessed with a little fey luck, and they often find themselves a few fortunate feet away from dangers during adventures.

name: Minotaur
source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse
description: Minotaurs are barrel-chested humanoids with heads resembling those of bulls. Blessed with a supernaturally strong sense of direction, minotaurs make great navigators.

name: Satyr
source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse
description: Originating in the Feywild—a realm of pure emotion— satyrs thrive on the energy of merriment.

name: Tabaxi
source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse
description: Created by the Cat Lord—a divine being of the Upper Planes—to blend the qualities of humanoids and cats, tabaxi are a varied people in both attitude and appearance.

name: Tortle
source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse
description: Carrying their shelter on their backs gives tortles a special feeling of security wherever they go, for even if they visit a far, unknown country, they have a place to lay their heads.

name: Leonin
description: Nomadic, lion-like humanoids who rarely interact with other peoples, having all they need in their shimmering homeland.

name: Loxodon
description: Humanoid elephants, loxodons are strong, calm, and wise.

name: Locathah
description: These resilient and proud fish-folk have endured war, slavery, and mistreatment at the hands of other aquatic creatures.

name: Bearfolk
description: All bearfolk share an inherent iron resolve. Only by banding together in tight-knit communities dedicated to fulfilling their noble purpose have the bearfolk miraculously continued to thrive.

name: Ratatosk
description: In recent decades, the squirrel-like beings called ratatosk have grown bored with simply safeguarding the World Tree and have decided to more actively battle corruption in the Shadow Realm.

name: Cervan
description: Cervans are a versatile deer-like folk who make their homes in small, intimate villages throughout Humblewood.

name: Corvum
description: Corvums are a crow-like race with dark feathers and sharp minds. Corvums are crafty and they tend to get what they want, one way or another.

name: Gallus
description: Gallus have a deep respect for nature and a love of gardening unmatched by other birdfolk. They value their social bonds above all else, and are always ready to help their neighbors.

name: Hedge
description: The most diplomatic and good natured of all the humblefolk, hedges like to live quiet lives in villages throughout the Wood, or within the safety of birdfolk perches.

name: Jerbeen
description: Jerbeens are small mouse-like folk with long, furred tails that help them balance.

name: Luma
description: Lumas are smaller than most birdfolk, and resemble either doves or pigeons. They are as often shunned for their eccentricities as they are celebrated for them.

name: Mapach
description: Naturally curious, mapachs are a medium-sized racoon-like race.

name: Raptor
description: Resembling small hawks, eagles, and other birds of prey, they have sharp talons and agile builds that help them effortlessly glide through the canopy.

name: Strig
description: Resembling owls, their thick feathers, solid bodies, and broad wings have earned them a reputation as the most powerful of the birdfolk races.

name: Vulpin
description: One of the least understood and most often vilified humblefolk in the Wood, vulpins have earned a bad reputation that isn’t entirely deserved.

name: Lizardfolk
source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse
description: Gifted by the gods with remarkable physical defenses and a mystical connection to the natural world, lizardfolk can survive with just their wits in situations that would be deadly for other folk.

name: Grung
description: Your grung character has an assortment of inborn abilities, part and parcel of grung nature.

name: Barbarian
subtitle: A Fierce Warrior of Primal Rage
description: Barbarians are mighty warriors who are powered by primal forces of the multiverse that manifest as a Rage.

name: Bard
subtitle: An Inspiring Performer of Music, Dance, and Magic
description: Bards are expert at inspiring others, soothing hurts, disheartening foes, and creating illusions.

name: Cleric
subtitle: A Miraculous Priest of Divine Power
description: Clerics can reach out to the divine magic of the Outer Planes and channel it to bolster people and battle foes.

name: Druid
subtitle: A Nature Priest of Primal Power
description: Druids call on the forces of nature, harnessing magic to heal, transform into animals, and wield elemental destruction.

name: Fighter
subtitle: A Master of All Arms and Armor
description: Fighters all share an unparalleled prowess with weapons and armor, and are well acquainted with death, both meting it out and defying it.

name: Monk
subtitle: A Martial Artist of Supernatural Focus
description: Monks focus their internal reservoirs of power to create extraordinary, even supernatural, effects.

name: Paladin
subtitle: A Devout Warrior of Sacred Oaths
description: Paladins live on the front lines of the cosmic struggle, united by their oaths against the forces of annihilation.

name: Ranger
subtitle: A Wandering Warrior Imbued with Primal Magic
description: Rangers are honed with deadly focus and harness primal powers to protect the world from the ravages of monsters and tyrants.

name: Rogue
subtitle: A Dexterous Expert in Stealth and Subterfuge
description: Rogues have a knack for finding the solution to just about any problem, prioritizing subtle strikes over brute strength.

name: Sorcerer
subtitle: A Dazzling Mage Filled with Innate Magic
description: Sorcerers harness and channel the raw, roiling power of innate magic that is stamped into their very being.

name: Warlock
subtitle: An Occultist Empowered by Otherworldly Pacts
description: Warlocks quest for knowledge that lies hidden in the fabric of the multiverse, piecing together arcane secrets to bolster their own power.

name: Wizard
subtitle: A Scholarly Magic-User of Arcane Power
description: Wizards cast spells of explosive fire, arcing lightning, subtle deception, and spectacular transformations.
